titleStmt.title: Nasik No. 4 (of Gautamīputra Śrī Sātakarṇi, year 18)

origin.origPlace: Nasik, on the east wall of the veranda in Cave No. 3, under the ceiling.

div.p: This edition is based on Senart 1905-1906.

sidhaṃ senāye vejayaṃjayatiye vijayakhadhāvārā govadhanasa benākaṭaka kā svāmi gotamiputo sirisadakakāṇi
ānapayati govadhane amaca viṇhupālitataṃ gāme aparakakhaḍiye ya yaṃ yaṃ ya ya khetaṃ ajakālakiyaṃ usabhadatena uṣabhadātena bhūtaṃ nivatanane
satāni be 200 eta amhakheta nivataṇasatātāṃni be 200 imesa pavajitāna tekirasiṇa na nā vitarāma etasa casa khetasa parihāra
vitarāma apavesa apāvesa apavesaṃ anomasa saṃ aloṇakhādaka araṭhasavinayaka savajātapāparihārika ca etahi na parihārehi pariharhi harahi harīhi
eteta casa khetaparihār re ca eta nibadhāpehi dho lihi
aviyena suviyeṇa aviyeṇa
āṇataṃ amacena sivagutena chato mahāsāmiyehi uparakhitotā
datā paṭikā savachare 18 14
Corrected to 18 by Bühler in his Die Indische Inschriften und die Kunstpoesie.
vāsapakhe vasāpakhe vasapakhe 2 divase 1 tāpasesana kaṭā
Success! From the camp of victory of the Vejayanti army, Gautamīputra Śrī Sātakarṇi, lord of Beṇākaṭaka of Govardhana, commands Viṣṇupālita, the officer at Govardhana:

The Ajakālakiya field in the village of Western Kakhaḍi, previously enjoyed by Usabhadata, — 200 — nivartanas, — that our field — two hundred — 200 — nivartanas — we confer on those Tekirasi ascetics; and to that field we grant immunity, (making it) not to be entered (by royal officers), not to be touched (by any of them), not to be dug for salt, not to be interfered with by the district police, and (in short) to enjoy all kinds of immunities; with those immunities invest it; and this field and these immunities take care to have registered here. Verbally ordered; written down by the officer Śivagupta; kept by the Mahāsāmiyas. The deed was delivered in the 18th year, on the 1st day of the 2nd fortnight of the rainy season; executed by Tāpasa.
